music

Class Chord

  • java.lang.Object
    • music.Chord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChordSequence

    public final class Chord
extends java.lang.Object
implements ChordSequence
    The Chord class represents a single note, a chord, or a rest. Chords are immutable.
    See Also:
    ChordSequence

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chord

        public Chord(Fraction duration,
     java.util.List<Note> notes)
        Instantiates a new chord.
        Parameters:
        duration - a Fraction representing the duration of the chord as a whole (this is the duration of the first note in the chord as specified in the abc format)
        notes - the list of notes associated with the chord. If empty, this Chord represents a rest. If size 1, this Chord represents a single note.

      • Chord

        public Chord(Fraction duration,
     Note... notes)
        Creates a new Chord.
        Parameters:
        duration - a Fraction representing the duration of the chord as a whole (this is the duration of the first note in the chord as specified in the abc format)
        notes - the notes associated with the chord. If 0 are given, this Chord represents a rest. If 1 is given, this Chord represents a single note.

      • Chord

        public Chord(Fraction duration,
     java.lang.String lyric,
     java.util.List<Note> notes)
        Creates a new Chord.
        Parameters:
        duration - a Fraction representing the duration of the chord as a whole (this is the duration of the first note in the chord as specified in the abc format)
        lyric - the lyric string associated with the chord.
        notes - the list of notes associated with the chord. If empty, this Chord represents a rest. If size 1, this Chord represents a single note.

      • Chord

        public Chord(Fraction duration,
     java.lang.String lyric,
     Note... notes)
        Creates a new Chord.
        Parameters:
        duration - a Fraction representing the duration of the chord as a whole (this is the duration of the first note in the chord as specified in the abc format)
        lyric - the lyric string associated with the chord.
        notes - the notes associated with the chord. If 0 are given, this Chord represents a rest. If 1 is given, this Chord represents a single note.

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • getChords

        public java.util.List<Chord> getChords()
        Description copied from interface: ChordSequence
        Gets the chords associated with this ChordSequence. Each Chord starts when the previous one ends, as encoded by Chord.duration (not to be confused with the duration of the individual notes within each Chord)
        Specified by:
        getChords in interface ChordSequence
        Returns:
        an immutable list containing only this Chord.
        See Also:
        ChordSequence.getChords()

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • multiply

        public Chord multiply(int numerator,
             int denominator)
        Multiply the duration of this chord by a fraction. Used for tuplets, so preconditions are that numerator and denominator must be between 1 and 10.
        Parameters:
        numerator - the numerator of the fraction with which to multiply the duration of this note
        denominator - the denominator of the fraction with which to multiply the duration of this note
        Returns:
        a new chord representing this chord scaled by the fraction given as parameters.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation (purely for debugging purposes)
        See Also:
        Object.toString()
